questions.question_text: An engineer implements the Cisco ACI solution and needs to confirm that the leaf switch correctly learns the remote endpoint MAC. Which information must be included in the VXLAN packet that is received from the Cisco ACI spine for the Cisco ACI leaf to learn MAC as a remote endpoint?

discussion.content:
Answer is Bridge Domain

Remote endpoint learning

Cisco ACI learns a MAC or IP address as a remote endpoint when a packet comes into a Cisco ACI leaf switch from another leaf switch through a spine switch. When a packet is sent from one leaf to another leaf, Cisco ACI encapsulates the original packet with an outer header representing the source and destination leaf Tunnel Endpoint (TEP) and the Virtual Extensible LAN (VXLAN) header, which contains the bridge domain or VRF information of the original packet.

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/solutions/collateral/data-center-virtualization/application-centric-infrastructure/white-paper-c11-739989.html

questions.question_text: Which action reduces the impact on workload when migrating from the existing Cisco NX-OS VXLAN network infrastructure to the Cisco ACI fabric?

choices.A: Disable bridge domain unicast routing while a default gateway is in VXLAN infrastructure
choices.C: Use ACI spines for the Cisco ACI and VXLAN fabrics
choices.B: Set the default gateway in the Cisco ACI and VXLAN fabrics
choices.D: Configure vPC between the standalone Nexus and the Cisco ACI leaf

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. Disable bridge domain unicast routing while a default gateway is in VXLAN infrastructure

before legacy infra is moved, ACI should have unicast routing disabled

Selected Answer: A
Link https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/switches/datacenter/aci/apic/sw/migration_guides/migrating_existing_networks_to_aci.html#_Toc27467765 and chapter "Default Gateway Migration Considerations" clearly states that in first phase - the answer is A. The other options do not make sense (having gateway on both worlds simultaneously ?? - will not work)

questions.question_text: How is multicast traffic managed in a Cisco ACI fabric?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. FTag trees are rooted at the spine nodes. Cisco APIC determines the roots.

A is correct 

Multicast Tree Topology
====================
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/switches/datacenter/aci/apic/sw/1-x/aci-fundamentals/b_ACI-Fundamentals/b_ACI-Fundamentals_chapter_010010.html

choices.D: FTag trees are rooted at the spine nodes. The roots must be configured manually.
choices.B: FTag trees are rooted at the leaf nodes. Cisco APIC determines the roots.
choices.A: FTag trees are rooted at the spine nodes. Cisco APIC determines the roots.
choices.C: FTag trees are rooted at the leaf nodes. The roots must be configured manually.

comments.content: In fact, you can. As long as you're using a common Interface Policy Group with type vPC.

discussion.content:
ACE seems more correct..
You can't use individual interface profiles for a vPC.. By using a common interface profile, any single interface chosen through the interface selector applies to both switches.

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. Which three actions should be taken to implement the vPC in the Cisco ACI fabric? (Choose three.)

choices.A: Select a common vPC interface policy group

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. Configure subnets that are shared between VRFs

C is correct 
Global - By default the scope of pcTag is local to VRF(Virtual Routing and Forwarding). However, in case of inter VRF contracts pcTag must have a global scope and should be unique across api fabric. Range 16-16385 is reserved for global use.

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/cloud-systems-management/application-policy-infrastructure-controller-apic/217302-application-centric-infrastructure-all.html

choices.D: Configure subnets that are private to VRF
choices.C: Configure subnets that are shared between VRFs
choices.A: Configure subnets that are treated as virtual IP

questions.question_text: Which action should be taken in Cisco ACI to reassign a unique globally scoped pcTag to an EPG that provides a global contract?
